section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 6. Chapter 6: Diseases of the Nervous System > b. Pain - Category G89 > 3) Postoperative Pain

content.full_text: The provider's documentation should be used to guide the coding of postoperative pain, as well as Section III. Reporting Additional Diagnoses and Section IV. Diagnostic Coding and Reporting in the Outpatient Setting. The default for post-thoracotomy and other postoperative pain not specified as acute or chronic is the code for the acute form. Routine or expected postoperative pain immediately after surgery should not be coded. (Evidence: pg no: 47, L49-L51)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding postoperative pain based on provider documentation, with default rules and exclusions for routine expected pain. (Evidence: pg no: 47, L49-L51)
key_concepts: Provider documentation guidance (Evidence: pg no: 47, L49)

Post-thoracotomy pain specifics (Evidence: pg no: 47, L50)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The provider's documentation should be used to guide the coding of postoperative pain (Evidence: pg no: 47, L49)
detailed_rules.explanation: Provider documentation is the primary source for determining appropriate postoperative pain codes (Evidence: pg no: 47, L49)

detailed_rules.rule_text: The default for post-thoracotomy and other postoperative pain not specified as acute or chronic is the code for the acute form (Evidence: pg no: 47, L50)
detailed_rules.explanation: When postoperative pain is not specified as acute or chronic, default to acute pain codes (Evidence: pg no: 47, L50)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Routine or expected postoperative pain immediately after surgery should not be coded (Evidence: pg no: 47, L51)
detailed_rules.explanation: Normal, expected postoperative pain that occurs immediately after surgery should not be assigned a pain code (Evidence: pg no: 47, L51)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review provider documentation for postoperative pain
Step 2: Determine if pain is routine/expected immediately after surgery
Step 3: If routine/expected, do not code
Step 4: If not routine, check if specified as acute or chronic
Step 5: If not specified, default to acute form
